ModuleDescription:
This course examines the impact of 1917 on European and global
history. We will examine the nature and experience of “total war,” the
life of women and children on the “home front,” and the diplomacy
and economics behind the bloodshed of the First World War that
marked the end of European hegemony in world politics. The course
also examines the Russian Revolution and the Bolsheviks, with a lasting
impact on 20th century history. Finally, the course uses the recent
anniversary of 1917 to compare and contrast forms of collective
memory and memorialization of war and revolution in Europe and
beyond.
